intro: Astragalus costatus, commonly known as the wavy milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has a taproot system that allows it to survive in arid conditions. Astragalus costatus is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and soil stabilization.
